qa.q: Do you want to perform data collection on your local machine or a remote machine?
What is the hostname or IP address of the remote machine that will perform collection?
What is the operating system of the remote machine that will perform collection?
What type of automation task would you like to perform?

choice.a: Interface with a CanaKit Relay board connected to the machine performing automation tasks.
Control a process running locally on the machine performing automation tasks.

qa.q: What is the serial port the CanaKit Relay board connected to? You can determine this by XYZ.
Which relay would you like to control?
Should the relay be ON or OFF by default?

choice.q: The relay should be ON by default.
The relay should be OFF by default.

qa.q: Should the relay be reset on the start of fuzzing?

choice.a: Yes, reset the relay at the start of fuzzing.
No, do not change the relay at the start of fuzzing.

qa.q: Should the relay be reset on every iteration?

choice.a: Yes, reset the relay at the start of every iteration.
No, do not change the relay at the start of an iteration.

qa.q: How long should the relay be held in the alternate state when being reset? For example, if the relay is ON by default, how long should it be held in the OFF state during a reset operation.
What is executable to run? This should include the full path. Peach includes macro defines for Peach working directory as well as the current working directory.
What are the arguments to the program? Macro defines are available, see expandable listing below.
When do you want to start the process?

choice.a: Once per fuzzing run, and after a fault is detected? For network fuzzing, this is the most likely selection.
At the start of every iteration?
At the end of every iteration? For file fuzzing, this is the most likely selection.

qa.q: If the process exists early, should that be considered a fault?

choice.a: Yes, if my process exists early, record that as a fault. This is common for network fuzzing.
No, it's okay if my process/service exits early. This is common for file fuzzing.
